channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for GA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for GA

Report X-2023061715

  • City: MIDLAND
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PKG WAS BEING UNLOADED WHEN BOX WAS DISCOVERED TO BE WET/Pkg was immediately sent to QA for inspection/ UPON INSPECTION, IT WAS DETERMINED THAT CONTAINER INSIDE INNER PACKAGING WAS LEAKING FROM THE TOP DescribePack: ONE CONTAINER INSIDE INNER PACKAGE IS LEAKING FROM THE CLOSED TOP DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE WAS PLACED IN A CONTAINER TO PREVENT ANY OTHER PACKAGES BEING DAMAGED DUE TO THE SPILLAGE

  • Description: During off loading the warehouse crew accidentally put a forklift fork into the one 5 gallon box/bladder bag of pro strip ultra (un3267) releasing 5gallons of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.title: Report E-2023070113
item.description:
Report E-2023070113

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-25T15:12:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-27
  • City: RICHMOND HILL
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: RANGER LANDSTAR INC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 28, 2023, at 05 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Richmond Hill, Georgia regarding the release of approximately (2) gallons of Aluma-Brite (Corrosive liquids, toxic, n.o.s., (Hydrofluoric Acid, Hydrochloric Acid, Phosphoric Acid), UN2922, 8, 6.1, II) from (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The release was reportedly due to a loose bung. Contractors were dispatched to clean up the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. The loose bung was tightened and the drum was forwarded on to the original consignee. All waste generated was containerized in (1) 55-gallon poly drum which was then taken offsite for proper disposal by the contractors.

Report X-2023061658

  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: PACKAGE WAS DISCOVERED LEAKING/WET IN THE LOADSIDE AREA. PACKAGE TAKEN TO HAZMAT AREA FOR PROCESSING. - DescribePack: CAPS OF INNER BOTTLES BECAME LOOSE. CONTENT OF BOTTLES BEGAN TO LEAK OUT AS A RESULT. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: UPON DISCOVERY, PACKAGE WAS PLACED INTO PLASTC BAG TO PREVENT FURTHER LEAKAGE IN THE AREA.
